Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0882 units. This forms the hexagonal prism with a cylindrical hole. Create the second face with a single loop that also consists of a circle. This circle has a center point at 0.0909, 0.6591 and a radius of 0.0909. Extrude both faces with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.7102 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The sketch scale should be set to 0.75. The boolean operation to use is "New Body Feature Operation". The resulting part is a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a pipe or a tube. The height of the part is 0.7102, the width is 0.75, and the length is also 0.75. **Part 2: Rectangular Prism with Curved Top** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0909, 0.0. The arc has a start point at 0.0, 0.0, a mid point at 0.0909, 0.0909, and an end point at 0.1818, 0.0. The line has a start point at 0.1818, 0.0 and an end point at 0.1818, 0.5682. The second arc has a start point at 0.1818, 0.5682, a mid point at 0.0909, 0.4773, and an end point at 0.0, 0.5682. The final line has a start point at 0.0, 0.5682 and an end point at 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the face with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0568 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The sketch scale should be set to 0.5682. The boolean operation to use is "Join Feature Operation". The resulting part is a rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges are rounded, and the sides are straight. The height of the part is 0.0568, the width is 0.5682, and the length is also 0.5682.</description>
